reviewText: Razor Ramon, Randy Savage, 1-2-3 Kid, and Marty Jannetty VS Diesel, Rick Martel, Adam Bomb, and I.R.S: This was a helluva way to open up the PPV and I really enjoyed this match overall.Bret, Owen, Keith, and Bruce Hart VS Shawn Michaels, Red Knight, Blue Night, and White Night: It was suppose to be Lawler instead of Michaels but something happened. I remember watching this match way back in 93 or 94 but havent watched it since for some reason. This would set up one of the best feuds in WWF/WWE history.Heavenly Bodies VS Rock N Roll Express for the Smoky Mountain Tag Titles: I've been impressed with the Heavenly Bodies with the few matches i've seen from there in. This was a decent match but I dont think the crowd cared for it as Heavenly Bodies win the tag titles in the end.Bushwhackers and Men on a Mission (dressed as Doinks) beat Headshrinkers, Bam Bam Bigelow, and Bastion Booger: Three talented men and Booger do a comedy job to two of the worst teams in the history of the WWF. Suppose to be funny but I really didnt laught at this crapfest.Lex Luger, The Steiner Brothers, and Undertaker VS Yokozuna, Ludvig Borga, Jacques, and Crush: I remember the back story to this match very well, even though it happened over seventeen years ago. The first fall looked like crap as Borga caught Rick Steiner and pinned him with a botched move. The Undertaker and Yokozuna do the standard count-out but would set up there feud for next year. It was a pretty good main event but not as good as the opener.Overall, the first match was the best match on the card. The Four Doinks match was the only real weak link on this card. Harts VS Michaels and Knights was decent and did set up a great feud. The main event delivered for the most part. Not the worst Survivor Series but far from one of the best.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The 1993 Survivor Series was the first and only WWF pay-per-view held in the historic Boston Garden. It was also the first time I attended a WWF pay-per-view. After some negative feedback from the previous year's event, the WWF wisely returned to the winning formula of four-on-four elimination tag action.The 1993 series saw The Macho Man entering as a substitution for Mr. Perfect, another chapter in the Bret Hart-Shawn Michaels feud, the beginning of the Bret vs. Owen feud, and the elustrious moments where Lex Luger joined up with Santa Claus(?). We also got to see the Bushwackers and Men On A Mission dressed up like Doink The Clown and The Heavenly Bodies win the Smoky Mountain Tag Team Title.At the time, this was one of my favorite PPV's but time has not done it justice. Today's fans may not enjoy it as much but it was still a hell of a show.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This event is just as bad as WCW's Greed PPV back in 2001. There were many substitutions that hurt the matches so badly like Randy Savage subbing for Mr.Perfect,HBK subbing for Jerry Lawler,Crush subbing for Quebecer Pierre and UnderTaker subbing Tatanka. The Worst matches on the card were The Family Feud match & The 4 Doinks vs. Team Bigelow match. No good matches at all at the PPV. By the way,NONE of the 4 Doinks were Doink himself. The main event between The All-Americans(Lex Luger,Undertaker,Rick Steiner & Scott Steiner) and The Foreign Fanatics(Yokozuna,Crush,Ludvig Borga & Quebecer Jacques) was bland and the confrontation between Luger & Borga was boring as a Ed Wood movie. I give this event a 0 out of 10.
summary: Just say no to Survivor Series 1993
Title: N/A

reviewText: 1993 Survivor SeriesNovember 24, 1993The Fable Old Boston GardenBoston, MassachusettsClassic Survivor Series Elimination Match:Razor Ramon, 1-2-3 Kid, Marty Jannetty, & "Macho Man" Randy SavageV.IRS, Diesel, Adam Bomb, & "The Model" Rick MartelGreat opener with some awesome spots and cool ending with The Kid & Jannetty surviving. ***3/4Classic Survivor Series Elimination Match:Bret Hart, Owen Hart, Bruce Hart, & Keith HartV.Shawn Michaels, Red Knight, Blue Knight, & White KnightJerry Lawler was suppose to be in this match, but was charged with Rape WOW! The charges were later dropped because the women was lying. However, this match was good but could have been better. The Harts are kicking Micahels' ass when it happened. All the Harts were left and only Micahels was left for his team. Bret was walking down the apron and Owen was in there with Shawn and then Shawn pushes Owen into Bret and Bret falls right on the barricade and when Owen wonders what happened, Shawn rolls him up! Minutes later the Harts finally eliminate Shawn and win the match, Owen comes down and said that it was Bret's fault that he was elminated. Great storyline, my favorite, of course. The match was a *** but the storyline with be the best that I have ever seen.Smoky Mountain Wrestling World Tag Team Championship:Rock N Roll Expess (Champions) V. Heavenly BodiesAwesome SMW Tag Team action (as always) with the Bodies winning the Tag Titles. ****Classic Survivor Series Elimination Match:Men On A MIssion & BushwackersV.Bam Bam Bigelow, Bastion Booger, & HeadshrinkersI laughed my ass off during this match. Funny as hell...which makes this a DUD classic. What a minute. Does that even make any sence? oh well...Classic Survivor Series Elimination Match:Lex Luger, Undertaker, & Steiner BrothersV.Yokozuna, Ludvig Borga, Crush, & Jacquesumm...this is the main event...I'm cool with that. However, im not cool with the Steiner Brothers getting their asses kicked for the first 15 minutes in this macth. Plus...Undie was hardly in there. For maybe 5 minutes. I know he was injuried..but come on. plus...Luger winning the match. I think you needed a heel to win because in every survivor series match...the faces won. I think a heel should have won. *3/4Overall, a kick ass show that had some good matches and comedy. I would like to add a little bit of the personal passion I will always have for the Boston Garden. I was born in Boston and I visit it aleast two times a year. I love Boston. I like the TD Banknorth Garden there in Boston. I have been there for Celtics playoff games & I know that the Boston Garden was very old, however, you didn't need to tear it down! It's a piece of Boston history. I loved going to the NBA Finals there when I was a kid. I loved Boston Garden and I have a huge Poster in my office of the Garden and I always look at it. It reminds him of my childhood & of where I really am from. I will miss the Boston Garden and like I said before, I like the new arena, but I will never get used to it. The only arena in the world were I would travel anywhere to was the Boston Garden. I wish I was there when it came down. If they made the Mid-South Coliseum in Memphis which is a toilet compared to the Boston Garden a historical landmark, they should have made the Bosotn Garden a landmoark too for goodness sake. There was more history in that building than Mid-South. Every single NBA Championship the Celtics have won was in Boston Garden. The great Bruins teams played in that building. The baners that hung for the rafters were amazing. I actually have a piece of the floor for the Garden and it's the more emtional thing I own. Ok...I'm done...thanks for reaidng.
summary: The Beginning To The Best Storyline in WWF History!!!!

reviewText: The highlight of this event is the Hart family match. Before you buy any WWF ppv from Wrestlemania X to Wrestlemania 13, if you are a fan of the Bret Vs. Owen feud, watch this and Royal Rumble '94 to get the full background on the greatest rivalry ever in the WWF!!! Historical significance.
summary: a pretty good event all around
